content: rook hat by sophia kessinger for this hat you will need yarn 1 to 2 skeins of a self-striping yarn like noro kureyon or swtc karaoke 1 skein will make an adult s/m size 2 skeins an adult m/l size adapting for a larger size is explained in the pattern hook size k removable stitch marker size & gauge kureyon 2 75 single_crochet over 1 makes a hat that would fit a 22 -23 circumference head karaoke 3 single_crochet over 1 makes a hat that would fit a 21 -22 circumference head terms slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet pm = place marker chain = chain the pattern it s called rook because the stitch pattern reminded my boyfriend of the top of the chess piece this was written specifically for self-striping yarn with the intention that it add a little fun texture and color displacement along the stripes the color changes in the yarn dictate when to move from one part of the pattern to the other chain 4 join with a slip_stitch to the 1st chain to form a loop 1 pm through the loop currently on the hook to mark beginning of round work 6 single_crochet in the loop 2 pm 2 single_crochet in every stitch around 3 pm *1 single_crochet in the next st 2 single_crochet in the following st* around 4 pm *1 single_crochet in each of the next 2 sts 2 single_crochet in the following st* around 5 pm *1 single_crochet in each of the next 3 sts 2 single_crochet in the following st* around 6 pm *1 single_crochet in each of the next 4 sts 2 single_crochet in the following st* around 7 pm *1 single_crochet in each of the next 5 sts 2 single_crochet in the following st* around 8 pm *1 single_crochet in each of the next 6 sts 2 single_crochet in the following st* around if you want a bigger hat add another round or two of increases here even rounds single_crochet in each st around for about 5 rounds or until you notice your yarn has totally changed to a different color you may be in the middle of a round it doesn t matter immediately go to v round v round pm *single_crochet in the next st double_crochet into the space 2 row below the next st* around ending with double_crochet into the space 2 row below the next st pictures for illustration of the v round the toothpick is indicating the space into which you double_crochet it s 2 row down and a bit to the left insert hook into this space draw up a loop of yarn and continue to work a double_crochet as usual continue the pattern by working more even rounds until the color changes again then working another v round repeat until you run out of yarn if you have a few skeins of the same yarn you can make a matching reversible rook scarf items made from pattern may
